plugins.name: Quick styles
plugins.description:
How does the plugin works:


Save a Style

1.Open the plugin library.

2.Select the layer you want to save styles from.

3.Click Save on one of the style slots in the plugin.

4.The style is saved!


Set a Shortcut

1.Open System Settings.

2.Navigate to Keyboard > Keyboard Shortcuts > App Shortcuts.

3.Click on the plus (+) icon.

4.Set the app to Figma in the menu.

5.Type the exact menu title name.

6.Set your shortcut and click Done!


Apply a Style

1.Select any layer.

2.Use the menu item or shortcut to apply styles!
plugins.tagline: Save properties of a layer and quickly apply them from the menu or using a shortcut.

plugins.name: Frame Flow
plugins.description:
The Figma plugin â€œFrame Flowâ€ allows you to duplicate the selected frame to the right or below with a predefined spacing. In addition to duplication, it also lets you insert blank frames at custom intervals. Itâ€™s especially useful when creating presentation documents, as it helps you add pages smoothly without disrupting the layout spacing. Setting up keyboard shortcuts is highly recommended for efficient use.

plugins.name: TextSwapper
plugins.description:
Features


Easily customize text for legal contracts, sales proposals, and resumes in Figma.

Quickly update text without needing extra tools.

Streamlined text replacement for multiple objects, components, and frames.

Simple and intuitive interface for seamless integration with your workflow.

Save time â° and eliminate the hassle of manually editing text in Figma!

How:


Add the word "page" to the name of your page frame (e.g., agreement_page).

Enter the text you want to replace in the "Find text" field (e.g., {company name}).

Enter the new text in the "Replace with" field (e.g., Figma).

Use the "Update" button to replace the specified line, or the "Update All" button to replace all occurrences of the text in your document.

Use the + and - buttons to adjust the number of text fields.

Click Save to store your list of text replacements for faster updates when working on the same document.

Use Load to retrieve your saved list of text replacements and automatically fill in the fields. The current version retrieves only the latest saved list.

Click Download Selected Pages as PDF to download the selected pages as one merged PDF file.
plugins.tagline: Easily customize text for legal contracts, sales proposals, and resumesâ€”no extra tools needed.

plugins.description:
Introduction

This plugin allows users to convert Markdown text into fully structured Figma frames automatically, enhancing design workflows and documentation processes.


Function Description

The plugin parses Markdown syntax and creates corresponding Figma frames and text elements, supporting headings, lists, bold text, and horizontal rules. It ensures that all content is visually organized according to Markdown structuring.


Usage Method

Simply input your Markdown text into the provided text area in the pluginâ€™s UI and click the â€˜Convert Markdownâ€™ button. The formatted content will appear as structured frames within your current Figma file.


Note

Ensure all text is properly formatted in Markdown before conversion. The frame width is fixed at 500px, but the height will adjust according to the content.

plugins.name: batchy
plugins.description:
batchy is a helper tool to make your exports more comfortable. Instead of just using the layer name and getting the layer size, you will now be able to write your own asset name dynamically with the help of export tokens and choosing between layer size or screen size for your assets.


Features

  1. dynamic asset names with several export tokens like: layers, date, file, scaling, index, user, top-level frame name,
  2. export assets in layer or screen size (top-level frame)
  3. export your current selection
  4. export from an asset list
  5. date formats for your naming
  6. export in common file formats like png, jpg, svg, pdf
  7. multiple files will be downloaded as a zip, single files will be downloaded as single files
  8. OS-proofed asset name support
plugins.tagline: Export your designs with dynamic name behaviors.

plugins.name: Text Extractor
plugins.description:
Plugin Features


Extract Text from Selected Figma Frames

Easily extract text from selected frames. Whether you select a single frame or multiple frames, you can quickly extract all the text within them.


Automatically Generate Variable Names

Automatically convert extracted text into variable names using camelCase format. This feature supports English text only, ensuring consistent and clean variable naming for your projects.


Create Custom Delimiter Sets

Design your own delimiter sets to wrap text with brackets, quotes, or any custom markers. Use intuitive keyboard shortcuts to apply these delimiters, enhancing your workflow for variable processing and other text transformation tasks.


Easily Copy and Paste

Effortlessly copy the extracted text and variable names to paste into Google Sheets or other tools.


Switch Between Design and Dev Modes

Support both design and dev modes, with dev mode as the default. Use design mode for a compact interface.

plugins.name: Variables Management
plugins.description:
This plugin remaps variables between libraries inside the Figma variable table.


Itâ€™s useful when working with two connected libraries. If both libraries are duplicated for a new project, then the libraries remain connected to the original libraries.


This plugin can automatically remap those variable connections with a new library.


Currently it's maping the variables inside Figma's variable table only.

accepted.name: Moon Design System (Public)
accepted.description: Moon is a complete design system built to help product teams across the world build better digital experiences.

plugins.name: Select by Style
plugins.description:
Select by Style makes it easy to find and select all elements on your page that share the same text or colour styling.


Perfect for designers who need to quickly audit styles, make bulk changes, or ensure consistency across their designs. Save time by selecting multiple elements at once instead of hunting them down individually.


What it does:

The plugin automatically scans your current page and organises all text styles and colour styles into easy-to-browse tables. Simply click on any style to instantly select all elements using that style across your page.


How to use it:

  1. Open the plugin to see all styles detected on your current page
  2. Browse the Text tab to see text styles with font details, sizes, and weights
  3. Browse the Colour tab to see colour styles with hex codes and opacity
  4. Use the search bar to quickly find specific styles by name, font, or colour
  5. Click any style row to select all elements using that style
  6. Use the Refresh button when you add new content to the page


Key features:

  1. Instant selection: Click once to select all elements with the same style
  2. Smart organisation: Separate tabs for text and colour styles with detailed information
  3. Search & filter: Quickly find styles by typing in the search box
  4. Library detection: See which styles are local vs. from external libraries
  5. Auto-refresh: Detects when you switch pages or add significant new content
  6. Live updates: Automatically updates when you change styles on selected elements


How are we doing? We're always working to make this plugin better and would genuinely appreciate hearing about your experience - and suggestions for enhancement.
plugins.tagline: Quickly select all elements using the same style

plugins.name: Auto Layout Remover
plugins.description:
Auto Layout Remover helps you quickly clean up messy Figma files and make them easier to edit or prototype.


When to use it:

  1. You want to redesign freely. If your design is full of auto layouts and deeply nested frames, and you just want to move things around without dealing with layout constraints â€” this plugin flattens everything so you can edit with ease.
  2. Youâ€™re building an interactive prototype. Auto layouts often create layers and nesting that block or overlap each other. This plugin helps you clean the structure fast â€” so you can bring the right blocks to the top and avoid layout issues.


What it does:

  1. Turns off all auto layouts, keeping objects in place
  2. Ungroups frames and groups without visible styles (no fill, no stroke, or hidden)
  3. Deletes hidden layers and empty frames
  4. Leaves instances and styled frames untouched
  5. Makes your file flat, clean, and easy to work with
plugins.tagline: Remove all auto layouts, empty frames, and groups in one click.

plugins.description: This plugin lets you export a ready-to-send XRechnung XML invoice from a structured Figma template (https://www.figma.com/community/file/1506387895617421047/xrechnung-invoice-template-for-freelancers-germany). It's built for freelancers and creatives working with German public-sector clients who need to submit invoices via portals like ZRE, OZG-RE, or PEPPOL. plugins.name: Get Image Type
plugins.description:
A simple plugin that analyzes your selected images and reveals their file formats with a single click. Stop guessing if that asset is a JPG, PNG, SVG, or WebP.


Does not support:

  1. Video/Movie Files: This plugin does not support identification of video or movie formats.


Note: Figma automatically converts certain image formats during import. HEIC and TIFF/TIF files are converted to PNG format when imported into Figma, so the plugin will identify these as PNGs. This reflects the actual format of the image within Figma, not necessarily the original source format.

accepted.name: Farren Wang
accepted.description: Farren's Figma account. Here you'll find stuff she's proud of.

plugins.tagline: Identify the format of images in your Figma designs

plugins.name: WCAG Contrast Auditor
plugins.description:
WCAG Contrast Auditor is a Figma plugin that helps you guarantee your text meets WCAG accessibility standardsâ€”no manual math or guesswork required. Simply:


  1. Select the text layers you want to check (or select a parent frame to audit everything inside).
  2. Pick your background color and target WCAG level (AA or AAA).
  3. Run Audit to instantly see how many layers pass or fail the chosen contrast threshold.


Key benefits:

  1. Automated compliance checks: Scan dozens or hundreds of text layers in seconds.
  2. Flexible thresholds: Choose between WCAG AA (4.5:1) or AAA (7:1) contrast ratios.
  3. Lightweight & zero setup: No external dependenciesâ€”just install and go.
  4. Actionable results: Get a quick pass/fail count so you know exactly where to focus your fixes.


Whether youâ€™re building design systems, client deliverables, or internal UIs, WCAG Contrast Auditor makes accessibility a seamless, one-click step in your workflow. Ensure every color combination is compliantâ€”and ship more inclusive products today!
plugins.tagline: Spot & Fix WCAG Contrast Issues Instantly.

Design global-ready UIsâ€”without ever leaving Figma.


Skip the guesswork and see how your designs hold up in other languages, scripts, and text directionsâ€”instantly. With Pseudo Localizer, you can preview localized versions of your UI in seconds, directly inside Figma or FigJam. No setup, no logins, no external tools. Just you and your design.

âœ… Preview global scripts instantly

Toggle between Latin, Cyrillic, CJK, and Arabic (RTL) with a single click.


âœ… Test layout resilience

Stretch or shrink text length from â€“50% to +50% to spot issues like clipping, wrapping, or misalignment.


âœ… Control the scope

Run it on a single button, a card, or the whole pageâ€”your call.


âœ… Keep it private & fast

Everything happens on your machine. No accounts, no external servers, no privacy worries.


â—ï¸Why it matters:


  1. Catch layout issues before they become bugs.
  2. Give your QA and localization teams better previews.
  3. Design smarter for a global audienceâ€”right from the start.


âš™ï¸ How it works:


  1. Select your screens with text layers (or don't select anything to pseudo translate the full page).
  2. Pick your script and text expansion.
  3. Click "Pseudotranslate"â€”done! A new page appears with your mocked-up, localized content (including RTL adjustments).

plugins.name: Lokki - Comments Export
plugins.description:
Description

A plugin that allows you to turn Figma comments into Jira tasks with a couple of clicks.


Key features

- Export comments to selected Jira project

- Filter comments

- Merge multiple comments into one.

- Turn comment into sub-issue of the existing Jira issue.


How to use

When you run the plugin, it offers a simple 3 step onboarding screen explaining how things work.

  1. During the first run, we'll ask you to connect your plugin with your Jira.
  2. Next you need to generate personal token that allows you access your comments. This is mandatory for plugins operation since Figma do not provide direct access to comments with figma plugin tools.
  3. Select Jira project that you will use as default. You can change it later.
  4. That's it. You can select comments and export them to the Jira.


Sidenote

This is our first-ever plugin on Figma, and while things might not be ideal all at once, we are happy to hear your feedback, questions, and suggestions at dev@lokki.tools

Webpage: https://lokki.tools


Data Security & Network access

Our plugin does not save any remote counterpart, it means your data is only stored on your computer, inside your Figma editor. This applies to all of your data, tokes and comments except user identifier related to the premium status and subscription info.


About

- Idea by Kseniia Pashkovska & Oleksandr Drobinin

- Implementation by Oleksandr Drobinin
plugins.tagline: Turn Figma comments into Jira tasks instantly

plugins.name: CopyCraft
plugins.description:
Streamline your text editing workflow with a powerful tool that helps you manage and edit text content across your Figma designs with precision and ease.

How it Works:


Text Loading:

Select any frame or text element in your Figma document and load it into the editor with a single click.


Smart Organization:

  1. Texts are automatically grouped by their parent elements (Frames, Components, or Groups)
  2. Each text element shows its character count and previous versions
  3. Intuitive interface for quick access to all text elements


Efficient Editing:

  1. Edit multiple text elements simultaneously
  2. Apply text styles directly from the editor
  3. Preview changes in real-time
  4. Navigate quickly to specific elements in your design


Key Features:

  1. Character counter for precise text control
  2. Previous version tracking for each text element
  3. Direct navigation to elements in your design
  4. Batch saving capabilities for groups of text
  5. Support for text styles application


Perfect for teams working on large-scale designs where maintaining text consistency and efficiency in editing is crucial.

plugins.name: Scout : Your Design System Auditor
plugins.description:
Scout: Your Design System Auditor

Ever felt like your design tokens are playing hide-and-seek? ğŸ•µï¸â€â™€ï¸ Meet Scout, your trusty design detectiveâ€”ready to sniff out sneaky inconsistencies and bring harmony back to your Figma universe!


Scout swiftly audits your Figma files, uncovering rogue color hexes and typography rebels that forgot their tokens at home. No more developer handoff blues or "Oops, missed that!" moments. ğŸ¯


Superpowers:

Color Detective: Catches color chaos quicker than you can shout â€œHex!â€


Typography Sleuth: Spots font fugitives and sizes that went astray, keeping your design tight.


Smart Suggestions: Suggests spot-on tokens and handy fallbacks instantlyâ€”because who doesn't love instant magic? âœ¨


Theme-Agnostic: Works seamlessly with both light and dark themes, maintaining style consistency across all modes.


Local Variable & Style Support: Perfectly compatible with local variables and styles, ensuring complete design system integration.


Pinpoint Precision: Clearly tells you exactly where the issue isâ€”no guessing games, just solutions!


How to Use Scout:


1. Feed Your Tokens: Connect Scout to your design system firstâ€”it'll securely save all your tokens locally.

2. Scan: Open Scout in any Figma file, select the frame you want to check, and hit "Scan."

3. Instant Results: Scout immediately highlights issues, suggests precise fixes, and ensures your designs stay token-perfect.


Scout is fun, quirky, and deadly accurate; a designer's best friend and a developer's dream come true. Let Scout do the heavy lifting and keep your designs perfectly polished. 


Get Scout today and give your design system the auditor it deserves.

plugins.name: Fijira
plugins.description:
Streamline your workflow and eliminate the gap between design and project management with Fijira. This powerful plugin seamlessly connects your Figma designs directly to your Jira tickets, ensuring that your development team always has access to the latest frames, feedback, and design specifications.


Stop wasting time manually exporting assets and pasting links. With Fijira, you can create detailed Jira comments, update ticket statuses, and link specific Figma frames directly from within your design file.


Key Features:


One-Click Jira Comments: Create rich, formatted comments in Jira tickets directly from Figma.

Automatic Frame Linking: Automatically attach a link to your selected Figma frame. If no frame is selected, you have the option to paste a link manually.

Status Updates: View available transitions and update the status of your Jira tickets without leaving Figma.

Simple Markdown Editor: Format your comments with bold, italics, lists, and links to keep your communication clear and organized.

Secure & Private: Your Jira credentials are saved securely in your local Figma storage and are never exposed. All communication happens through a secure, private proxy server.

Easy Setup: A simple, one-time setup for your Jira domain, email, and API token gets you started in minutes.

How to Use:


Run the Plugin: Open Fijira from the plugins menu.

Enter Your Settings: In the settings view, enter your Jira domain (e.g., your-company.atlassian.net), your Jira account email, and a valid Jira API token.

Select a Frame (Optional): Select a single frame in your Figma file that you want to link.

Fill in Commit Details: In the commit view, enter a commit title, a detailed description (using the markdown editor!), and the target Jira issue key (e.g., PROJ-123).

Update Status (Optional): Choose a new status for your Jira ticket from the dropdown menu.

Commit! Click "Commit & Update Jira". Fijira will post your comment, link, and status change to the specified Jira ticket and create a new version in your Figma file history.

Say goodbye to context switching and hello to a more efficient workflow with Fijira!
plugins.tagline: Sync your Figma designs with Jira issue, seamlessly.

Simple Markdown Editor: Format your comments with bold, italics, lists, and links to keep your communication clear and organized.

Secure & Private: Your Jira credentials are saved securely in your local Figma storage and are never exposed. All communication happens through a secure, private proxy server.

Easy Setup: A simple, one-time setup for your Jira domain, email, and API token gets you started in minutes.

How to Use:


Run the Plugin: Open Fijira from the plugins menu.

Enter Your Settings: In the settings view, enter your Jira domain (e.g., your-company.atlassian.net), your Jira account email, and a valid Jira API token.

Select a Frame (Optional): Select a single frame in your Figma file that you want to link.

Fill in Commit Details: In the commit view, enter a commit title, a detailed description (using the markdown editor!), and the target Jira issue key (e.g., PROJ-123).

Update Status (Optional): Choose a new status for your Jira ticket from the dropdown menu.

Commit! Click "Commit & Update Jira". Fijira will post your comment, link, and status change to the specified Jira ticket and create a new version in your Figma file history.

Say goodbye to context switching and hello to a more efficient workflow with Fijira!
136661.tagline: Sync your Figma designs with Jira issue, seamlessly.

plugins.name: Font Replacer
plugins.description:
Instantly view all fonts used in your selection, selectively replace specific font families, and preserve font weights and styles when switching to new fonts. Whether you're cleaning up inconsistent typography, updating your brand, or exploring new typefaces, Font Replacer makes the process fast, intuitive, and reliable.


  1. See all fonts in your selection at a glance
  2. Replace one or multiple font families with a single click
  3. Maintains font weights/styles (e.g., Bold, Italic) when switching families
  4. Handles mixed-font text layers and nested groups
  5. Smart fallbacks ensure your text always looks great
  6. Clean, modern UI with loading indicators for large selections
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly swap and manage fonts in your Figma designs
